code: @Manual{,   title = {flextable: Functions for Tabular Reporting},   author = {David Gohel and Panagiotis Skintzos},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.9.11.022},   url = {https://ardata-fr.github.io/flextable-book/}, }

title: Functions for Tabular Reporting
text: flextable package provides framework easily create tables reporting publications. Tables can easily formatted set verbs bold(), color(), can receive header one line, cells can merged contain image. package make possible build table publication data.frame provides sugar function as_flextable() convert several R objects flextable, object return table() model. Tables can embedded within HTML, PDF, Word PowerPoint documents R Markdown documents within RTF Microsoft Word PowerPoint documents package officer. Tables can also rendered R plots graphic files (png).  flextable object data.frame representation. API available let R users create tables reporting control formatting properties layout. package provides functions give control : header, body footer content text, paragraphs, cells border formatting element displayed values package also offers set high-level functions allow tabular reporting statistical models creation complex cross tabulations.
code: flextable(mtcars) %>%    theme_vanilla() %>%    save_as_docx(path = "mytable.docx")

title: Functions for Tabular Reporting
code: library(flextable) set_flextable_defaults(   font.family = "Arial", font.size = 10,    border.color = "gray", big.mark = "")  ft <- flextable(head(mtcars)) |>    bold(part = "header")  ft ft |>    highlight(i = ~ mpg < 22, j = "disp", color = "#ffe842") |>    bg(j = c("hp", "drat", "wt"),       bg = scales::col_quantile(palette = c("wheat", "red"), domain =NULL)) |>    add_footer_lines("The 'mtcars' dataset") ggplot2::diamonds[, c("cut", "carat", "price", "clarity", "table")] |>    summarizor(by = c("cut")) |>    as_flextable(spread_first_col = TRUE)

title: Functions for Tabular Reporting
text: can get development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("flextable") devtools::install_github("davidgohel/flextable")

what: Add column values as new lines in body — add_body
title: Add column values as new lines in body — add_body
text: function adds list values inserted new rows body. values inserted existing columns input data flextable. Rows can inserted top bottom body. columns provided, replaced NA displayed empty.

title: Add column values as new lines in body — add_body
code: add_body(x, top = TRUE, ..., values = NULL)

title: Add column values as new lines in body — add_body
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. top rows inserted top bottom. ... named arguments (names data colnames) values add. important insert data type original data, otherwise transformed (probably strings add character double expected). makes possible still format cell contents colformat_* functions, example colformat_num(). values list name-value pairs labels values, names existing col_key values. argument can used instead ... programming purpose (values supplied argument ... ignored).

title: Add body labels — add_body_row
text: Add row new columns labels body part. Labels can spanned along multiple columns, merged cells. Labels associated number columns merge default one specified. case, make sure number labels equal number columns displayed. function can add one single row call. Labels can also formatted as_paragraph().

title: Add body labels — add_body_row
code: add_body_row(x, top = TRUE, values = list(), colwidths = integer(0))

title: Add body labels — add_body_row
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. top row inserted top bottom. values values add. can list, character() vector call as_paragraph(). list, can named list names columns original data.frame colkeys; recommended method allows keep original data types therefore allows perform conditional formatting. character, columns original data.frame stored flextable object changed character(); often issue footer header can inconvenient adding rows body change data types character prevent efficient conditional formatting. colwidths number columns merge row label

title: Set text alignment — align
text: Change text alignment selected rows columns flextable.

title: Set text alignment — align
code: align(   x,   i = NULL,   j = NULL,   align = "left",   part = c("body", "header", "footer", "all") )  align_text_col(x, align = "left", header = TRUE, footer = TRUE)  align_nottext_col(x, align = "right", header = TRUE, footer = TRUE)

title: Set text alignment — align
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. row selector, see section Row selection parameter <Selectors flextable>. j column selector, see section Column selection j parameter <flextable column selection>. align text alignment - single character value, vector character values equal length number columns selected j. Expected values must set ('left', 'right', 'center', 'justify'). number columns multiple length align parameter, values align recycled across remaining columns. part part selector, see section Part selection part parameter <Selectors flextable>. Value '' can used. header header aligned body footer footer aligned body

what: Transform a mixed model into a flextable — as_flextable.merMod
title: Transform a mixed model into a flextable — as_flextable.merMod
text: produce flextable describing mixed model. function using package 'broom.mixed' provides data presented resulting flextable. can remove significance stars setting options options(show.signif.stars = FALSE).

what: Transform a 'tables::tabular' object into a flextable — as_flextable.tabular
title: Transform a 'tables::tabular' object into a flextable — as_flextable.tabular
text: Produce flextable 'tabular' object produced function tables::tabular(). as_flextable.tabular=TRUE, first column used row separator acting row title. can formated arguments fp_p (formatting properties paragraph) row_title specifies content eventually formattings content. Two hidden columns can used conditional formatting creation flextable (use spread_first_col=TRUE): column .row_title contains title label column .type can contain following values: "one_row": Indicates one row group. case, row expanded title . "list_title": Indicates row serves title data displayed . "list_data": Indicates rows follow title contain data displayed. result paginated (see paginate()).

title: Transform a 'tables::tabular' object into a flextable — as_flextable.tabular
code: # S3 method for class 'tabular' as_flextable(   x,   spread_first_col = FALSE,   fp_p = fp_par(text.align = "center", padding.top = 4),   row_title = as_paragraph(as_chunk(.row_title)),   add_tab = FALSE,   ... )

code: if (require("tables")) {   set.seed(42)   genders <- c("Male", "Female")   status <- c("low", "medium", "high")   Sex <- factor(sample(genders, 100, rep = TRUE))   Status <- factor(sample(status, 100, rep = TRUE))   z <- rnorm(100) + 5   fmt <- function(x) {     s <- format(x, digits = 2)     even <- ((1:length(s)) %% 2) == 0     s[even] <- sprintf("(%s)", s[even])     s   }   tab <- tabular(     Justify(c) * Heading() * z *       Sex * Heading(Statistic) *       Format(fmt()) *       (mean + sd) ~ Status   )   as_flextable(tab) } #> Loading required package: tables title: Transform a 'tabulator' object into a flextable — as_flextable.tabulator

TRUE, single row groups multi-row groups restructured. sep_w blank column separators'width used. 0, blank column separators used. unit unit argument sep_w, one "", "cm", "mm". ... unused argument

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(flextable)  set_flextable_defaults(digits = 2, border.color = "gray")  if (require("stats")) {   dat <- aggregate(breaks ~ wool + tension,     data = warpbreaks, mean   )    cft_1 <- tabulator(     x = dat,     rows = "wool",     columns = "tension",     `mean` = as_paragraph(as_chunk(breaks)),     `(N)` = as_paragraph(       as_chunk(length(breaks))     )   )    ft_1 <- as_flextable(cft_1, sep_w = .1)   ft_1 }  if (require("stats")) {   set_flextable_defaults(     padding = 1, font.size = 9,     border.color = "orange"   )    ft_2 <- as_flextable(cft_1, sep_w = 0)   ft_2 }  if (require("stats")) {   set_flextable_defaults(     padding = 6, font.size = 11,     border.color = "white",     font.color = "white",     background.color = "#333333"   )    ft_3 <- as_flextable(     x = cft_1, sep_w = 0,     rows_alignment = "center",     columns_alignment = "right"   )   ft_3 }  init_flextable_defaults() } # }

code: library(officer) if( require("xtable") ){    data(tli)   tli.table <- xtable(tli[1:10, ])   align(tli.table) <- rep("r", 6)   align(tli.table) <- "|r|r|clr|r|"   ft_1 <- as_flextable(     tli.table,     rotate.colnames = TRUE,     include.rownames = FALSE)   ft_1 <- height(ft_1, i = 1, part = "header", height = 1)   ft_1    # \donttest{   Grade3 <- c("A","B","B","A","B","C","C","D","A","B",     "C","C","C","D","B","B","D","C","C","D")   Grade6 <- c("A","A","A","B","B","B","B","B","C","C",     "A","C","C","C","D","D","D","D","D","D")   Cohort <- table(Grade3, Grade6)   ft_2 <- as_flextable(xtable(Cohort))   ft_2 <- set_header_labels(ft_2, rowname = "Grade 3")   ft_2 <- autofit(ft_2)   ft_2 <- add_header(ft_2, A = "Grade 6")   ft_2 <- merge_at(ft_2, i = 1, j = seq_len( ncol(Cohort) ) + 1,     part = "header" )   ft_2 <- bold(ft_2, j = 1, bold = TRUE, part = "body")   ft_2 <- height_all(ft_2, part = "header", height = .4)   ft_2    temp.ts <- ts(cumsum(1 + round(rnorm(100), 0)),     start = c(1954, 7), frequency = 12)   ft_3 <- as_flextable(x = xtable(temp.ts, digits = 0),     NA.string = "-")   ft_3   # }   detach("package:xtable", unload = TRUE) } #> Loading required package: xtable #>  #> Attaching package: ‘xtable’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:flextable’: #>  #>     align

title: 'Word' computed field — as_word_field
code: library(flextable)  # define some default values ---- set_flextable_defaults(font.size = 22, border.color = "gray")  # an example with append_chunks ---- pp_docx <- function(x) {   x <- add_header_lines(x, "Page ")   x <- append_chunks(     x = x, i = 1, part = "header", j = 1,     as_word_field(x = "Page")   )   align(x, part = "header", align = "left") } ft_1 <- flextable(cars) ft_1 <- autofit(ft_1) ft_1 <- pp_docx(ft_1)  ## or: # set_flextable_defaults(post_process_docx = pp_docx) ## to prevent this line addition when output is not docx  # print(ft_1, preview = "docx")  # an example with compose ----  library(officer) ft_2 <- flextable(head(cars)) ft_2 <- add_footer_lines(ft_2, "temp text") ft_2 <- compose(   x = ft_2, part = "footer", i = 1, j = 1,   as_paragraph(     "p. ",     as_word_field(x = "Page", width = .05),     " on ", as_word_field(x = "NumPages", width = .05)   ) ) ft_2 <- autofit(ft_2, part = c("header", "body"))  doc <- read_docx() doc <- body_add_flextable(doc, ft_2) doc <- body_add_break(doc) doc <- body_add_flextable(doc, ft_2) outfile <- print(doc, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))  # reset default values ---- init_flextable_defaults()

what: Add flextable into a Word document — body_add_flextable
title: Add flextable into a Word document — body_add_flextable
text: Add flextable Word document created 'officer'.

title: Add flextable into a Word document — body_add_flextable
code: body_add_flextable(   x,   value,   align = NULL,   pos = "after",   split = NULL,   topcaption = TRUE,   keepnext = NULL )

title: Add flextable into a Word document — body_add_flextable
text: x rdocx object value flextable object align left, center (default) right. align parameter still supported time , recommend using set_flextable_defaults(table_align = "center") instead set default alignment flextables R session, define alignement table set_table_properties(align = "center"). pos add flextable relative cursor, one "", "", "" (end line). split set TRUE want activate Word option 'Allow row break across pages'. argument still supported time , recommend using set_flextable_defaults(split = TRUE) instead set default setting flextables R session, define alignement table set_table_properties() argument opts_word=list(split = TRUE) instead. topcaption TRUE caption added table, FALSE, caption added table. keepnext Defunct favor paginate(). default value used keep_with_next set set_flextable_defaults(keep_with_next = TRUE).

title: Add flextable into a Word document — body_add_flextable
text: Use paginate() function define whether table displayed one pages, whether header displayed first lines table body page. Use set_caption() function define formatted captions (as_paragraph()) simple captions (string). topcaption can used insert caption table (default) table (use FALSE).

title: Add flextable into a Word document — body_add_flextable
code: library(officer)  # define global settings set_flextable_defaults(   split = TRUE,   table_align = "center",   table.layout = "autofit" )  # produce 3 flextable ft_1 <- flextable(head(airquality, n = 20)) ft_1 <- color(ft_1, i = ~ Temp > 70, color = "red", j = "Temp") ft_1 <- highlight(ft_1, i = ~ Wind < 8, color = "yellow", j = "Wind") ft_1 <- set_caption(   x = ft_1,   autonum = run_autonum(seq_id = "tab"),   caption = "Daily air quality measurements" ) ft_1 <- paginate(ft_1, init = TRUE, hdr_ftr = TRUE)  ft_2 <- proc_freq(mtcars, "vs", "gear") ft_2 <- set_caption(   x = ft_2,   autonum = run_autonum(seq_id = "tab", bkm = "mtcars"),   caption = as_paragraph(     as_b("mtcars"), " ",     colorize("table", color = "orange")   ),   fp_p = fp_par(keep_with_next = TRUE) ) ft_2 <- paginate(ft_2, init = TRUE, hdr_ftr = TRUE)  ft_3 <- summarizor(iris, by = "Species") ft_3 <- as_flextable(ft_3, spread_first_col = TRUE) ft_3 <- set_caption(   x = ft_3,   autonum = run_autonum(seq_id = "tab"),   caption = "iris summary" ) ft_3 <- paginate(ft_3, init = TRUE, hdr_ftr = TRUE)  # add the 3 flextable in a new Word document doc <- read_docx() doc <- body_add_flextable(doc, value = ft_1) doc <- body_add_par(doc, value = "") doc <- body_add_flextable(doc, value = ft_2) doc <- body_add_par(doc, value = "") doc <- body_add_flextable(doc, value = ft_3)  fileout <- tempfile(fileext = ".docx") print(doc, target = fileout)

title: Set bold font — bold
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. row selector, see section Row selection parameter <Selectors flextable>. j column selector, see section Column selection j parameter <flextable column selection>. bold boolean value part part selector, see section Part selection part parameter <Selectors flextable>. Value '' can used.

title: Set bold font — bold
code: ft <- flextable(head(iris)) ft <- bold(ft, bold = TRUE, part = "header")

title: Cell borders update — border
text: change borders selected rows columns flextable. function used end user (requires careful settings avoid overlapping borders) programming purposes. need add borders, use instead functions: set borders whole table : border_outer(), border_inner_h() border_inner_v(). add horizontal vertical lines table specific location, use: hline(): set bottom borders (inner horizontal) vline(): set right borders (inner vertical) add following horizontal vertical lines beginning end table, use: hline_top(): set top border (outer horizontal) hline_bottom(): set bottom border (outer horizontal) vline_left(): set left border (outer vertical) vline_right(): set right border (outer vertical) want highlight specific cells borders, use surround().

title: Cell borders update — border

what: Compact Summary of a Dataset — compact_summary
title: Compact Summary of a Dataset — compact_summary
text: Produces compact summary data.frame. row result describes one column input type-specific synopsis. Supported types summaries: numeric / integer: count non-NA values, min max. character: number unique values, first values listed. factor: number levels, levels listed. logical: count non-NA values, counts TRUE FALSE. Date: count non-NA values, date range. POSIXct / POSIXlt: count non-NA values, datetime range. hms / difftime: count non-NA values, time range. Character factor columns share summary layout report different type label. result class "compact_summary" can converted flextable as_flextable().

title: Compact Summary of a Dataset — compact_summary
code: compact_summary(x, show_type = FALSE, show_na = FALSE, max_levels = 10L)

text: x data.frame. show_type TRUE, Type column added object rendered flextable. show_na TRUE, NA column showing count missing values per column added rendered flextable. max_levels Maximum number levels unique values displayed factor character columns. Additional values replaced ", ...".

what: data.frame automatic printing as a flextable — df_printer
title: data.frame automatic printing as a flextable — df_printer
text: Create summary data.frame flextable. function used R Markdown document. use function, must declare part df_print 'YAML' header R Markdown document:   notice unexpected behavior bookdown. using bookdown necessary use use_df_printer() instead setup run chunk:
code: --- df_print: !expr function(x) flextable::df_printer(x) --- use_df_printer()

title: data.frame automatic printing as a flextable — df_printer

title: data.frame automatic printing as a flextable — df_printer

title: data.frame automatic printing as a flextable — df_printer
text: 'knitr' chunk options available customize output: ft_max_row: number rows print. Default 10. ft_split_colnames: column names split (non alpha-numeric characters). Default FALSE. ft_short_strings: character column shorten. Default FALSE. ft_short_size: Maximum length character column ft_short_strings TRUE. Default 35. ft_short_suffix: Suffix add character values shorten. Default "...". ft_do_autofit: Use autofit() rendering table. Default TRUE. ft_show_coltype: Show column types. Default TRUE. ft_color_coltype: Color use column types. Default "#999999".

what: Fix border issues when cell are merged — fix_border_issues
title: Fix border issues when cell are merged — fix_border_issues
text: cells merged, rendered borders first cell. column made three merged cells, bottom border seen bottom border first cell column. user point view, wrong, bottom one defined cell 3. function modify border values avoid effect. Note since version 0.9.7 function called automatically rendering, user call function anymore.

title: Fix border issues when cell are merged — fix_border_issues
code: fix_border_issues(x, part = "all")

title: Fix border issues when cell are merged — fix_border_issues
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. part part selector, see section Part selection part parameter <Selectors flextable>. Value '' can used.

title: Fix border issues when cell are merged — fix_border_issues
code:
library(officer) dat <- data.frame(a = 1:5, b = 6:10) ft <- flextable(dat) ft <- theme_box(ft) ft <- merge_at(ft, i = 4:5, j = 1, part = "body") ft <- hline(ft, i = 5, part = "body", border = fp_border(color = "red", width = 5) ) print(ft) #> #>

what: flextable: Functions for Tabular Reporting — flextable-package
title: flextable: Functions for Tabular Reporting — flextable-package
text: flextable package facilitates access manipulation tabular reporting elements R. documentation functions can opened command help(package = "flextable"). flextable() function producing flexible tables cell can contain several chunks text set formatting properties (bold, font color, etc.). Function mk_par() lets customise text cells. as_flextable() function used transform specific objects flextable objects. example, can transform crosstab produced 'tables' package flextable can formatted, annotated augmented footnotes. order reduce homogenization efforts number functions called, recommended define formatting properties font, border color, number decimals displayed applied default. See set_flextable_defaults() details.

title: flextable: Functions for Tabular Reporting — flextable-package
text: flextable composed three distinct parts: header: default, contains one row column names data.frame body: Contains actual data data.frame footer: Empty default, can contain content (commonly used footnotes #' summary rows)   basic flextable : part 'header': 1 row column names part 'body': many rows input data.frame footer Rows columns can added removed basic flextable: Add new rows header add_header(), add_header_row(), add_header_lines() set_header_labels(). Add new rows footer add_footer(), add_footer_lines(), set_header_footer_df() add_footer_row(). Add new rows body add_body() add_body_row(). Delete columns delete_columns(). Delete part delete_part(). Use column names separate simple header row multiple nested rows separate_header().
code: HEADER         <- Column names, labels, spanning headers --------------------         BODY          <- Data rows --------------------        FOOTER         <- Summary rows, notes, footnotes (optional)

title: flextable: Functions for Tabular Reporting — flextable-package
text: Selectors core feature flextable allow specify parts (part), rows () columns (j) affected formatting, styling, content operations. See corresponding manual: <Selectors flextable>.

title: flextable: Functions for Tabular Reporting — flextable-package
text: Maintainer: David Gohel david.gohel@ardata.fr Authors: Panagiotis Skintzos panagiotis.skintzos@ardata.fr contributors: ArData [copyright holder] Clementine Jager [contributor] Eli Daniels [contributor] Quentin Fazilleau [contributor] Maxim Nazarov [contributor] Titouan Robert [contributor] Michael Barrowman [contributor] Atsushi Yasumoto [contributor] Paul Julian [contributor] Sean Browning [contributor] Rémi Thériault (ORCID) [contributor] Samuel Jobert [contributor] Keith Newman [contributor]

title: flextable creation — flextable
text: Create flextable object function flextable. flextable designed make tabular reporting easier R users. Functions available let format text, paragraphs cells; table cells can merge vertically horizontally, row headers can easily defined, rows heights columns widths can manually set automatically computed. working 'R Markdown' documents, read knitr chunk options knit_print.flextable() setting default values set_flextable_defaults().

title: flextable creation — flextable
code: flextable(   data,   col_keys = names(data),   cwidth = 0.75,   cheight = 0.25,   defaults = list(),   theme_fun = theme_booktabs,   use_labels = TRUE )  qflextable(data)

title: flextable creation — flextable
text: data dataset col_keys columns names/keys display. column names dataset, added blank columns default. cwidth, cheight initial width height use cell sizes inches. defaults, theme_fun deprecated, use set_flextable_defaults() instead. use_labels Logical; TRUE, column labels value labels present dataset used display purposes. Defaults TRUE.

title: flextable creation — flextable
text: default formatting properties automatically applied every flextable produce. highly recommended use function use minimize code. example, instead calling fontsize() function new flextable, set font size default value calling (creating flextables) set_flextable_defaults(font.size = 11). also simple way homogeneous arrays make documents containing easier read. can change default values function set_flextable_defaults(). can reset function init_flextable_defaults(). can access values calling get_flextable_defaults().

title: flextable creation — flextable
text: 'flextable' package translate new lines expressed form \n tabs expressed form \t. new lines transformed "soft-return", say simple carriage return new paragraph. Tabs different depending output format: HTML using entity em space Word - Word 'tab' element PowerPoint - PowerPoint 'tab' element latex - tag "\quad "

title: flextable creation — flextable
text: flextable made 3 parts: header, body footer. functions argument named part used specify part table modified.

title: flextable creation — flextable

title: Selectors in flextable — flextable_selectors
text: Selectors core feature flextable allow specify parts (part), rows () columns (j) affected formatting, styling, content operations. Many flextable functions support selectors, including bg(), bold(), color(), padding(), fontsize(), italic(), align(), mk_par(), hline(), vline(), many others. Selectors make conditional formatting easy enable seamless piping multiple operations using %>% |>.

what: Row selection with the i parameter
title: Selectors in flextable — flextable_selectors
text: parameter used select specific rows flextable formatting, styling, content operations. = NULL (default), operations apply rows.   Best practices: Use formulas (= ~ condition) conditional selection body Use integers positional selection part. Use nrow_part() dynamic row selection
code: i = ~ condition           # Formula (body only) i = 1:5                   # Integer vector i = c(TRUE, FALSE, ...)   # Logical vector i = NULL                  # All rows (default)

what: Column selection with the j parameter
title: Selectors in flextable — flextable_selectors
text: j parameter used select specific columns flextable formatting, styling, content operations. j = NULL (default), operations apply columns.   Best practices: Use character vectors (j = c("col1", "col2")) clarity maintainability. Use formulas (j = ~ col1 + col2) excluding columns using use_dot = TRUE. Avoid integer positions possible (less maintainable). Column selectors work parts (header, body, footer, ).
code: j = ~ col1 + col2         # Formula (select multiple) j = ~ . - col1            # Formula (exclude columns) j = c("col1", "col2")     # Character vector (recommended) j = 1:5                   # Integer vector j = c(TRUE, FALSE, ...)   # Logical vector j = NULL                  # All columns (default)

what: Part selection with the part parameter
title: Selectors in flextable — flextable_selectors
text: part parameter specifies section flextable affected formatting, styling, content operations.   part = "body" (default), operations apply data rows. part = "", operation applied part independently. Formula row selectors (= ~ condition) used : part = "header" - Headers contain character values part = "footer" - Footers contain character values part = "" - Header/footer character-body original data types restriction exists formula selectors evaluate conditions using actual data types dataset (numeric, logical, etc.). Headers footers store character representations values, conditional expressions like = ~ price < 330 evaluated .
code: part = "body"    # Data rows (default) part = "header"  # Header rows part = "footer"  # Footer rows part = "all"     # All parts

title: Selectors in flextable — flextable_selectors
text: Selectors part, j supported many flextable functions: Formatting Functions style() - Apply multiple formatting properties bold(), italic() - Text weight style color(), highlight() - Text background colors fontsize(), font() - Font properties align(), valign() - Text alignment padding(), line_spacing() - Spacing properties bg() - Background color rotate() - Text rotation Border Functions hline(), vline() - Horizontal vertical lines border_outer(), border_inner_h(), border_inner_v() - Border styling Content Functions mk_par() - Define custom cell content append_chunks(), prepend_chunks() - Add content chunks Layout Functions merge_at(), merge_v(), merge_h() - Merge cells width(), height() - Set dimensions empty_blanks() - Format blank columns

title: Selectors in flextable — flextable_selectors
text: Function nrow_part() returns number lines part.   Function ncol_keys() returns number columns.
code: # Format the last row differently ft <- flextable(iris[48:52,]) ft <- bold(ft, i = nrow_part(ft, part = "body"))  # Add footnote to last row ft <- footnote(   ft,   i = nrow_part(ft, part = "body"), j = 1:4,   value = as_paragraph("Calculated mean") ) ft # Get column count ncol_keys(ft)  # Useful for programmatic selection ncols <- ncol_keys(ft) ft <- bg(ft, j = rep(c(TRUE, FALSE), length.out = ncols), bg = "#f0f0f0") ft

title: Knitr rendering in loops and if statements — flextable_to_rmd

title: Knitr rendering in loops and if statements — flextable_to_rmd
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(rmarkdown) if (pandoc_available() &&   pandoc_version() > numeric_version("2")) {   demo_loop <- system.file(     package = "flextable",     "examples/rmd",     "loop_with_flextable.Rmd"   )   rmd_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".Rmd")   file.copy(demo_loop, to = rmd_file, overwrite = TRUE)   render(     input = rmd_file, output_format = "html_document",     output_file = "loop_with_flextable.html"   ) } } # }

code: library(flextable) z <- summarizor(iris, by = "Species")  tab_1 <- tabulator(   x = z,   rows = c("variable", "stat"),   columns = "Species",   blah = as_paragraph(     as_chunk(       fmt_summarizor(         stat = stat,         num1 = value1, num2 = value2,         cts = cts, pcts = percent       )     )   ) )  ft_1 <- as_flextable(x = tab_1, separate_with = "variable") ft_1 <- labelizor(   x = ft_1, j = "stat",   labels = c(     mean_sd = "Moyenne (ecart-type)",     median_iqr = "Mediane (IQR)",     range = "Etendue",     missing = "Valeurs manquantes"   ) ) ft_1 <- title: Add footnotes to flextable — footnote
text: function let add footnotes flextable object adding symbols flextable associated notes footer flextable. Symbols added cells designated selection j. use = c(1,3) j = c(2,5), add symbols (repeated symbol) cells [1,2] [3,5]. title: Add footnotes to flextable — footnote
code: footnote(   x,   i = NULL,   j = NULL,   value,   ref_symbols = NULL,   part = "body",   inline = FALSE,   sep = "; ",   symbol_sep = "" )

title: Add footnotes to flextable — footnote
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. row selector, see section Row selection parameter <Selectors flextable>. j column selector, see section Column selection j parameter <flextable column selection>. value call function as_paragraph(). ref_symbols character value, symbols append used references notes. part part selector, see section Part selection part parameter <Selectors flextable>. Value '' allowed function. inline whether add footnote line previous footnote sep used inline = TRUE, character string use separator footnotes. symbol_sep separator insert multiple footnote symbols cell (e.g. "," produce 1,2 instead 12). Default "" (separator, backward compatible).

title: Text formatting properties — fp_text_default
text: Create officer::fp_text() object uses defaut values defined flextable applies . fp_text_default() handy function allow specify certain formatting values applied piece text, formatting values specified simply existing formatting values. example, set text cell red previously, using code fp_text_default(bold = TRUE), formatting 'bold' also 'red'. hand, fp_text() function forces specify parameters, strongly recommend working fp_text_default() created replace use former. See also set_flextable_defaults() modify flextable defaults formatting properties.

title: Text formatting properties — fp_text_default
code: fp_text_default(   color = flextable_global$defaults$font.color,   font.size = flextable_global$defaults$font.size,   bold = FALSE,   italic = FALSE,   underlined = FALSE,   strike = FALSE,   font.family = flextable_global$defaults$font.family,   cs.family = NULL,   eastasia.family = NULL,   hansi.family = NULL,   vertical.align = "baseline",   shading.color = "transparent" )

title: Text formatting properties — fp_text_default
text: color font color - single character value specifying valid color (e.g. "#000000" "black"). font.size font size (point) - 0 positive integer value. bold bold italic italic underlined underlined strike strikethrough font.family single character value. Specifies font used format characters Unicode range (U+0000-U+007F). cs.family optional font used format characters complex script Unicode range. example, Arabic text might displayed using "Arial Unicode MS" font. eastasia.family optional font used format characters East Asian Unicode range. example, Japanese text might displayed using "MS Mincho" font. hansi.family optional. Specifies font used format characters Unicode range fall one categories. vertical.align single character value specifying font vertical alignments. Expected value one following : default 'baseline' 'subscript' 'superscript' shading.color shading color - single character value specifying valid color (e.g. "#000000" "black").

title: Text formatting properties — fp_text_default

what: Convert a flextable to a grid grob object — gen_grob
title: Convert a flextable to a grid grob object — gen_grob
text: uses Grid Graphics (package grid) Convert flextable grob object scaling text wrapping capabilities. method can used insert flextable inside ggplot2 plot, can also used package 'patchwork' 'cowplot' combine ggplots flextables graphic. User can vary size elements according size graphic window. text behavior controllable, user can decide make paragraphs (texts images) distribute correctly available space cell. possible define resizing options, example using width, distributing content occupies whole graphic space. also possible freeze size columns. recommended use function large tables calculations can long. Limitations: equations (see as_equation()) hyperlinks (see officer::hyperlink_ftext()) displayed. 'ragg' 'svglite' 'ggiraph' graphical device drivers used ensure correct rendering.

title: Convert a flextable to a grid grob object — gen_grob
code: gen_grob(   x,   ...,   fit = c("auto", "width", "fixed"),   scaling = c("min", "full", "fixed"),   wrapping = TRUE,   autowidths = TRUE,   just = NULL )

title: Convert a flextable to a grid grob object — gen_grob
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. ... Reserved extra arguments fit Determines fitting/scaling grob parent viewport. One auto, width, fixed, TRUE, FALSE: auto TRUE (default): grob resized fit parent viewport. table row heights column widths resized proportionally. width: grob resized horizontally fit width parent viewport. column widths resized proportionally. row heights unaffected table height may smaller larger height parent viewport. fixed FALSE: grob fixed dimensions, determined column widths row heights. scaling Determines scaling table contents. One min, full, fixed, TRUE, FALSE: min TRUE (default): parent viewport smaller necessary, various content sizes (text font size, line width image dimensions) decrease accordingly content can still fit. parent viewport larger necessary, content sizes remain , increase. full: min, except content sizes scaled fully, increase decrease, according size drawing surface. fixed FALSE: content sizes scaled. wrapping Determines soft wrapping (line breaking) method table cell contents. One TRUE, FALSE: TRUE: Text content may wrap separate lines normal word break points (space tab character two words) newline characters anywhere text content. word fit available cell width, text content may wrap character. Non-text content (images) also wrapped new lines, according available cell width. FALSE: Text content may wrap newline character. Non-text content wrapped. Superscript subscript chunks wrap. Newline tab characters removed chunk types. autowidths TRUE (default) column widths adjusted order fit contents cells (taking account wrapping setting). just Justification viewport layout, just argument grid::grid.layout(). set NULL (default), determined according fit argument.

title: Convert a flextable to a grid grob object — gen_grob
text: grob (gTree) object made package grid

title: Convert a flextable to a grid grob object — gen_grob
text: size flextable can known using method dim grob.

title: Convert a flextable to a grid grob object — gen_grob
text: important note captions part table . means exporting table PNG SVG formats (image formats), caption included. Captions intended document outputs like Word, HTML, PDF, tables embedded within document .

title: Convert a flextable to a grid grob object — gen_grob
code: library(ragg) library(gdtools) register_liberationsans() #> [1] TRUE  set_flextable_defaults(font.family = "Liberation Sans")  ft <- flextable(head(mtcars))  gr <- gen_grob(ft)  png_f_1 <- tempfile(fileext = ".png") ragg::agg_png(   filename = png_f_1, width = 4, height = 2,   units = "in", res = 150) plot(gr) dev.off() #> agg_record_738606595  #>                    2   png_f_2 <- tempfile(fileext = ".png") # get the size dims <- dim(gr) dims #> $width #> [1] 8.25 #>  #> $height #> [1] 1.777778 #>  ragg::agg_png(   filename = png_f_2, width = dims$width + .1,   height = dims$height + .1, units = "in", res = 150 ) plot(gr) dev.off() #> agg_record_738606595  #>                    2    if (require("ggplot2")) {   png_f_3 <- tempfile(fileext = ".png")   z <- summarizor(iris, by = "Species")   ft <- as_flextable(z, spread_first_col = TRUE)   ft <- color(ft, color = "gray", part = "all")   gg <- ggplot(data = iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Petal.Width)) +     annotation_custom(       gen_grob(ft, scaling = "full"),       xmin  = 4.5, xmax = 7.5, ymin = 0.25, ymax = 2.25) +     geom_point() +     theme_minimal()   ragg::agg_png(     filename = png_f_3, width = 7,     height = 7, units = "in", res = 150   )   print(gg)   dev.off() } #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> agg_record_738606595  #>                    2

code: library(data.table) library(flextable) if (require("ggplot2")) {   my_cor_plot <- function(x) {     cols <- colnames(x)[sapply(x, is.numeric)]     x <- x[, .SD, .SDcols = cols]     cormat <- as.data.table(cor(x))     cormat$var1 <- colnames(cormat)     cormat <- melt(cormat,       id.vars = "var1", measure.vars = cormat$var1,       variable.name = "var2", value.name = "correlation"     )     ggplot(data = cormat, aes(x = var1, y = var2, fill = correlation)) +       geom_tile() +       coord_equal() +       scale_fill_gradient2(         low = "blue",         mid = "white", high = "red", limits = c(-1, 1),         guide = "none"       ) +       theme_void()   }   z <- as.data.table(iris)   z <- z[, list(gg = list(my_cor_plot(.SD))), by = "Species"]   ft <- flextable(z)   ft <- title: Render flextable with 'knitr' — knit_print.flextable
text: Supported formats require minimum pandoc versions: output format HTML, Word, PDF (e.g., rtf_document, github_document, beamer_presentation), image generated instead.

title: Render flextable with 'knitr' — knit_print.flextable
text: features, often specific output format, available help configure global settings relatve table output. knitr's chunk options used change default settings: HTML, PDF Word: ft.align: flextable alignment, supported values 'left', 'center' 'right'. default value 'center'. HTML : ft.htmlscroll, can TRUE FALSE (default) enable horizontal scrolling. Use set_table_properties() options scrolling. Word : ft.split Word option 'Allow row break across pages' can activated TRUE (default value). ft.keepnext defunct favor paginate() PDF : ft.tabcolsep space text left/right border containing cell, default value 0 points. ft.arraystretch height row relative default height, default value 1.5. ft.latex.float type floating placement document, one : 'none' (default value), table placed preceding paragraph. 'float', table can float place text fits best 'wrap-r', wrap text around table positioned right side text 'wrap-l', wrap text around table positioned left side text 'wrap-', wrap text around table positioned inside edge-near binding 'wrap-o', wrap text around table positioned outside edge-far binding PowerPoint : ft.left, ft.top Position defined options. Theses top left coordinates inches placeholder contain table. default values 1 2 inches. values used time document, recommended set values 'knitr r chunk' using function knitr::opts_chunk$set(ft.split=FALSE, ...).

title: Render flextable with 'knitr' — knit_print.flextable

Note bookdown using officedown::rdocx_document(), usual numbering feature bookdown used. tab.id='my_id'. options available customise captions output: Word output officedown::rdocx_document() used coming options ability choose prefix numbering chunk example. table expose options:

title: Paginate tables — paginate
text: Prevents breaks tables rows want stay together. feature applies Word RTF output.

title: Paginate tables — paginate
code: paginate(   x,   init = NULL,   hdr_ftr = TRUE,   group = character(),   group_def = c("rle", "nonempty") )

title: Paginate tables — paginate
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. init init value keep_with_next property, default value get_flextable_defaults()$keep_with_next. hdr_ftr TRUE (default), prevent breaks table body header table body footer. group name column use finding groups group_def algorithm used identify groups split two pages, one 'rle', 'nonempty': 'rle': runs equal values used define groups, used tabulator(). 'nonempty': non empty value start new group, used as_flextable.tabular().

title: Paginate tables — paginate
text: updated flextable object

title: Paginate tables — paginate
text: pagination tables allows control position relation page breaks. small tables, simple setting usually used indicates rows displayed together:   large tables, recommended use setting indicates rows header bound first row table avoid case header displayed alone bottom page repeated next one:   tables present groups want presented two pages, must use parameterization involving notion group algorithm determining groups.
code: paginate(x, init = TRUE, hdr_ftr = TRUE) paginate(x, init = FALSE, hdr_ftr = TRUE) paginate(x, group = "grp", group_def = "rle")

title: Paginate tables — paginate
code: library(data.table) library(flextable)  init_flextable_defaults()  multi_fun <- function(x) {   list(mean = mean(x), sd = sd(x)) }  dat <- as.data.table(ggplot2::diamonds) dat <- dat[clarity %in% c("I1", "SI1", "VS2")]  dat <- dat[, unlist(lapply(.SD, multi_fun),   recursive = FALSE ), .SDcols = c("z", "y"), by = c("cut", "color", "clarity") ]  tab <- tabulator(   x = dat, rows = c("cut", "color"),   columns = "clarity",   `z stats` = as_paragraph(as_chunk(fmt_avg_dev(z.mean, z.sd, digit2 = 2))),   `y stats` = as_paragraph(as_chunk(fmt_avg_dev(y.mean, y.sd, digit2 = 2))) )  ft_1 <- as_flextable(tab) ft_1 <- autofit(x = ft_1, add_w = .05) ft_1 <- paginate(ft_1, group = "cut", group_def = "rle")  save_as_docx(ft_1, path = tempfile(fileext = ".docx")) save_as_rtf(ft_1, path = tempfile(fileext = ".rtf"))

what: Add a flextable into a PowerPoint slide — ph_with.flextable
title: Add a flextable into a PowerPoint slide — ph_with.flextable
text: Add flextable PowerPoint document object produced officer::read_pptx(). function create native PowerPoint table flextable result can eventually edited.

title: Add a flextable into a PowerPoint slide — ph_with.flextable
code: # S3 method for class 'flextable' ph_with(x, value, location, ...)

title: Add a flextable into a PowerPoint slide — ph_with.flextable
text: x pptx device value flextable object location location placeholder. See officer::ph_location_type() example. ... unused arguments.

title: Add a flextable into a PowerPoint slide — ph_with.flextable
text: width height table can set location. Use functions width(), height(), autofit() dim_pretty() instead. overall size resulting cells, paragraphs text properties (.e. padding, font size, border widths).

title: Add a flextable into a PowerPoint slide — ph_with.flextable
text: Captions printed PowerPoint slides. captions useful document formats like Word, RTF, HTML, PDF, directly supported PowerPoint slides. Unlike documents defined layout, PowerPoint slides lack structured document flow. function like HTML documents paginated formats (RTF, Word, PDF). makes technically challenging determine ideal placement caption within slide. Additionally, including caption within table feasible.

title: Add a flextable into a PowerPoint slide — ph_with.flextable
code: library(officer)  ft <- flextable(head(iris))  doc <- read_pptx() doc <- add_slide(doc, "Title and Content", "Office Theme") doc <- ph_with(doc, ft, location = ph_location_left())  fileout <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx") print(doc, target = fileout)

title: Plot a flextable — plot.flextable
code: library(gdtools) library(ragg) register_liberationsans() #> [1] TRUE set_flextable_defaults(font.family = "Liberation Sans") ftab <- as_flextable(cars)  tf <- tempfile(fileext = ".png") agg_png(   filename = tf, width = 1.7, height = 3.26, unit = "in",   background = "transparent", res = 150 ) plot(ftab) dev.off() #> agg_record_197856790  #>                    2

title: Mini plots chunk wrapper — plot_chunk

title: Mini plots chunk wrapper — plot_chunk
text: value numeric vector, stored list column. width, height size resulting png file inches type type plot: 'box', 'line', 'points' 'density'. free_scale scales free (TRUE FALSE, default value). unit unit width height, one "", "cm", "mm". ... arguments sent plot functions (see par())

title: Mini plots chunk wrapper — plot_chunk
text: chunk option requires package officedown R Markdown context Word output format. PowerPoint mix images text paragraph, images removed outputing PowerPoint format.

title: Mini plots chunk wrapper — plot_chunk
text: Species Sepal.Length boxplot density setosa 5.006   versicolor 5.936   virginica 6.588
code: library(data.table) library(flextable)  z <- as.data.table(iris) z <- z[, list(   Sepal.Length = mean(Sepal.Length, na.rm = TRUE),   z = list(.SD$Sepal.Length) ), by = "Species"]  ft <- flextable(z,   col_keys = c("Species", "Sepal.Length", "box", "density") ) ft <- mk_par(ft, j = "box", value = as_paragraph(   plot_chunk(     value = z, type = "box",     border = "red", col = "transparent"   ) )) ft <- mk_par(ft, j = "density", value = as_paragraph(   plot_chunk(value = z, type = "dens", col = "red") )) ft <- set_table_properties(ft, layout = "autofit", width = .6) ft <- title: flextable old functions — regulartable
code: regulartable(data, col_keys = names(data), cwidth = 0.75, cheight = 0.25)

title: flextable old functions — regulartable
text: data dataset col_keys columns names/keys display. column names dataset, added blank columns default. cwidth, cheight initial width height use cell sizes inches.

title: Rotate cell text — rotate
text: can useful change text direction table headers large. example, header labels can rendered "tbrl" (top bottom right left), corresponding 90-degree rotation, "btlr", corresponding 270-degree rotation. function changes cell text direction. default, "lrtb", means left right top bottom. 'Word' 'PowerPoint' handle automatic height rotated headers. Therefore, need set header heights (height() function) set rule "exact" row heights (hrule() function); otherwise, Word PowerPoint outputs insufficient height properly display text. flextable rotate text arbitrary angles. rotates right angles (90-degree increments). choice ensures consistent rendering across Word, PowerPoint (limited angles 0, 270, 90), HTML, PDF.

title: Rotate cell text — rotate

title: Add a 'flextable' into an RTF document — rtf_add.flextable
text: officer::rtf_add() method adding flextable objects 'RTF' documents.

code: # S3 method for class 'flextable' rtf_add(x, value, ...)

title: Add a 'flextable' into an RTF document — rtf_add.flextable
text: x rtf object, created officer::rtf_doc(). value flextable object ... unused arguments

title: Add a 'flextable' into an RTF document — rtf_add.flextable
code: library(flextable) library(officer)  ft <- flextable(head(iris)) ft <- autofit(ft)  z <- rtf_doc() z <- rtf_add(z, ft)  print(z, target = tempfile(fileext = ".rtf")) #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp4M6RrT/file259142ed3cae.rtf"

title: Save flextable objects in a 'Word' file — save_as_docx
text: ... flextable objects, objects, possibly named. named objects, names used titles. values list (possibly named), element flextable object. named objects, names used titles. provided, argument ... ignored. path Word file created pr_section officer::prop_section object can used define page layout orientation, width height. align left, center (default) right.

text: string containing full name generated file

title: Save flextable objects in a 'Word' file — save_as_docx
code: tf <- tempfile(fileext = ".docx")  library(officer) ft1 <- flextable(head(iris)) save_as_docx(ft1, path = tf)   ft2 <- flextable(head(mtcars)) sect_properties <- prop_section(   page_size = page_size(     orient = "landscape",     width = 8.3, height = 11.7   ),   type = "continuous",   page_margins = page_mar() ) save_as_docx(   `iris table` = ft1, `mtcars table` = ft2,   path = tf, pr_section = sect_properties )

title: Save flextable objects in an 'HTML' file — save_as_html
code: ft1 <- flextable(head(iris)) tf1 <- tempfile(fileext = ".html") if (rmarkdown::pandoc_available()) {   save_as_html(ft1, path = tf1)   # browseURL(tf1) }  ft2 <- flextable(head(mtcars)) tf2 <- tempfile(fileext = ".html") if (rmarkdown::pandoc_available()) {   save_as_html(     `iris table` = ft1,     `mtcars table` = ft2,     path = tf2,     title = "rhoooo"   )   # browseURL(tf2) }

title: Modify flextable defaults formatting properties — set_flextable_defaults
text: font.family single character value. format Word, specifies font used format characters Unicode range (U+0000-U+007F). want use non ascii characters Word, also set hansi.family family name. font.size font size (point) - 0 positive integer value. font.color font color - single character value specifying valid color (e.g. "#000000" "black"). text.align text alignment - single character value, expected value one 'left', 'right', 'center', 'justify'. padding padding (shortcut top, bottom, left right padding) padding.bottom, padding.top, padding.left, padding.right paragraph paddings - 0 positive integer value. border.color border color - single character value (e.g. "#000000" "black"). border.width border width points. background.color cell background color - single character value specifying valid color (e.g. "#000000" "black"). line_spacing space lines text, 1 single line spacing, 2 double line spacing. table.layout 'autofit' 'fixed' algorithm. Default 'autofit'. cs.family optional Word. Font used format characters complex script Unicode range. example, Arabic text might displayed using "Arial Unicode MS" font. eastasia.family optional Word. Font used format characters East Asian Unicode range. example, Japanese text might displayed using "MS Mincho" font. hansi.family optional Word. Font used format characters Unicode range fall one categories. decimal.mark, big.mark, na_str, nan_str formatC arguments used colformat_num(), colformat_double(), colformat_int(). digits formatC argument used colformat_double(). pct_digits number digits percentages. fmt_date, fmt_datetime formats date datetime columns documented strptime(). Default '%Y-%m-%d' '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'. extra_css css instructions integrated table. scroll NULL list want add scroll-box. See scroll element argument opts_html function set_table_properties(). table_align default flextable alignment, supported values 'left', 'center' 'right'. split Word option 'Allow row break across pages' can activated TRUE. keep_with_next default initialization value used paginate() function corresponding Word option "keep rows together" defined array. tabcolsep space text left/right border containing cell. arraystretch height row relative default height, default value 1.5. float type floating placement PDF document, one : 'none' (default value), table placed preceding paragraph. 'float', table can float place text fits best 'wrap-r', wrap text around table positioned right side text 'wrap-l', wrap text around table positioned left side text 'wrap-', wrap text around table positioned inside edge-near binding 'wrap-o', wrap text around table positioned outside edge-far binding fonts_ignore TRUE, pdf-engine pdflatex can used instead xelatex lualatex. pdflatex used, fonts ignored supported pdflatex, whereas xelatex lualatex engines . theme_fun single character value (name theme function applied) theme function (input flextable, output flextable). post_process_all Post-processing function allow customize table. executed call post_process_pdf(), post_process_docx(), post_process_html(), post_process_pptx(). post_process_pdf, post_process_docx, post_process_html, post_process_pptx Post-processing functions allow customize display output type (pdf, html, docx, pptx). executed just printing table. ... unused deprecated arguments

title: Global table properties — set_table_properties
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. layout 'autofit' 'fixed' algorithm. Default 'fixed'. width parameter different effect depending output format. Users consider minimum width. HTML, minimum width space table occupy. Word, preferred size Word may decide strictly stick . effect PowerPoint PDF output. default value 0, effect, use necessary width display content. used PDF output. align alignment document (Word, HTML PDF), supported values 'left', 'center' 'right'. opts_html html options list. Supported elements : 'extra_css': extra css instructions integrated HTML code table. 'scroll': NULL list want add scroll-box. Use empty list add horizontal scroll.  fixed, corresponding container's width. list value named height used height scroll happen also vertically. height pixel numeric, string valid css measure. list value named freeze_first_column set TRUE, first column set sticky column. list value named add_css used extra css add, ..e: border:1px solid red;. 'extra_class': extra classes add table tag opts_word Word options list. Supported elements : 'split':  Word option 'Allow row break across pages' can activated TRUE. 'keep_with_next': Word option 'keep rows together' activated TRUE. avoids page break within tables. handy small tables, .e. less page height. 'repeat_headers': Word option 'Repeat header row' activated associated header rows TRUE. opts_pdf PDF options list. Supported elements : 'tabcolsep': space text left/right border containing cell. 'arraystretch': height row relative default height, default value 1.5. 'float': type floating placement PDF document, one : 'none' (default value), table placed preceding paragraph. 'float', table can float place text fits best 'wrap-r', wrap text around table positioned right side text 'wrap-l', wrap text around table positioned left side text 'wrap-', wrap text around table positioned inside edge-near binding 'wrap-o', wrap text around table positioned outside edge-far binding 'fonts_ignore': TRUE, pdf-engine 'pdflatex' can used instead 'xelatex' 'lualatex.' pdflatex used, fonts ignored supported pdflatex, whereas xelatex lualatex engines . 'caption_repeat': boolean indicates caption repeated along pages. default value TRUE. 'footer_repeat': boolean indicates footer repeated along pages. default value TRUE. 'default_line_color': default line color, restored globally flextable produced. word_title alternative text Word table (used title table) word_description alternative text Word table (used description table)

title: Create a shift table — shift_table
text: Create shift table ready used tabulator(). function transforming dataset representing 'Laboratory Tests Results' structured CDISC clinical trial data sets format dataset representing shift table. Shift tables tables used clinical trial analysis. show progression change baseline, progression often along time; number subjects displayed different range (e.g. low, normal, high) baseline selected time points intervals.

title: Create a shift table — shift_table
code: shift_table(   x,   cn_visit = "VISIT",   cn_visit_num = "VISITNUM",   cn_grade = "LBNRIND",   cn_usubjid = "USUBJID",   cn_lab_cat = NA_character_,   cn_is_baseline = "LBBLFL",   baseline_identifier = "Y",   cn_treatment = NA_character_,   grade_levels = c("LOW", "NORMAL", "HIGH"),   grade_labels = c("Low", "Normal", "High") )

title: Create a shift table — shift_table
text: x Laboratory Tests Results data frame. cn_visit column name containing visit names, default "VISIT". cn_visit_num column name containing visit numbers, default "VISITNUM". cn_grade column name containing reference range indicators, default "LBNRIND". cn_usubjid column name containing unique subject inditifiers, default "USUBJID". cn_lab_cat column name containing lab tests examination names, default "LBTEST". cn_is_baseline column name containing baseline flags, default "LBBLFL". baseline_identifier baseline flag value use baseline identification. default "Y". cn_treatment column name containing treatment names, default NA. grade_levels levels use reference range indicators grade_labels labels use reference range indicators

title: Create a shift table — shift_table
text: shift table data.frame. Additionnal elements provided attributes: "VISIT_N": count unique subject id per visits, labs eventually treatments. element supposed used value argument hidden_data function tabulator(). "FUN_VISIT": utility function easily turn visit column factor column. applied shift table creation. "FUN_GRADE": utility function easily turn grade column factor column. adds "MISSING/Missing" "SUM/Sum" end set values specified arguments grade_levels grade_labels. applied shift table creation.

title: Create a shift table — shift_table
code: library(data.table) library(flextable)  # data simulation ---- USUBJID <- sprintf("01-ABC-%04.0f", 1:200) VISITS <- c("SCREENING 1", "WEEK 2", "MONTH 3") LBTEST <- c("Albumin", "Sodium")  VISITNUM <- seq_along(VISITS) LBBLFL <- rep(NA_character_, length(VISITNUM)) LBBLFL[1] <- "Y"  VISIT <- data.frame(   VISIT = VISITS, VISITNUM = VISITNUM,   LBBLFL = LBBLFL, stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) labdata <- expand.grid(   USUBJID = USUBJID, LBTEST = LBTEST,   VISITNUM = VISITNUM,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) setDT(labdata)  labdata <- merge(labdata, VISIT, by = "VISITNUM")  subject_elts <- unique(labdata[, .SD, .SDcols = "USUBJID"]) subject_elts <- unique(subject_elts) subject_elts[, c("TREAT") := list(   sample(x = c("Treatment", "Placebo"), size = .N, replace = TRUE) )] #>          USUBJID     TREAT #>           <char>    <char> #>   1: 01-ABC-0001   Placebo #>   2: 01-ABC-0002 Treatment #>   3: 01-ABC-0003   Placebo #>   4: 01-ABC-0004   Placebo #>   5: 01-ABC-0005 Treatment #>  ---                       #> 196: 01-ABC-0196 Treatment #> 197: 01-ABC-0197   Placebo #> 198: 01-ABC-0198 Treatment #> 199: 01-ABC-0199 Treatment #> 200: 01-ABC-0200   Placebo subject_elts[, c("TREAT") := list(   factor(.SD$TREAT, levels = c("Treatment", "Placebo")) )] #>          USUBJID     TREAT #>           <char>    <fctr> #>   1: 01-ABC-0001   Placebo #>   2: 01-ABC-0002 Treatment #>   3: 01-ABC-0003   Placebo #>   4: 01-ABC-0004   Placebo #>   5: 01-ABC-0005 Treatment #>  ---                       #> 196: 01-ABC-0196 Treatment #> 197: 01-ABC-0197   Placebo #> 198: 01-ABC-0198 Treatment #> 199: 01-ABC-0199 Treatment #> 200: 01-ABC-0200   Placebo setDF(subject_elts) labdata <- merge(labdata, subject_elts,   by = "USUBJID", all.x = TRUE, all.y = FALSE ) labdata[, c("LBNRIND") := list(   sample(     x = c("LOW", "NORMAL", "HIGH"), size = .N,     replace = TRUE, prob = c(.03, .9, .07)   ) )] #> Key: <USUBJID> #>           USUBJID VISITNUM  LBTEST       VISIT LBBLFL   TREAT LBNRIND #>            <char>    <int>  <char>      <char> <char>  <fctr>  <char> #>    1: 01-ABC-0001        1 Albumin SCREENING 1      Y Placebo  NORMAL #>    2: 01-ABC-0001        1  Sodium SCREENING 1      Y Placebo    HIGH #>    3: 01-ABC-0001        2 Albumin      WEEK 2   <NA> Placebo  NORMAL #>    4: 01-ABC-0001        2  Sodium      WEEK 2   <NA> Placebo  NORMAL #>    5: 01-ABC-0001        3 Albumin     MONTH 3   <NA> Placebo  NORMAL #>   ---                                                                 #> 1196: 01-ABC-0200        1  Sodium SCREENING 1      Y Placebo  NORMAL #> 1197: 01-ABC-0200        2 Albumin      WEEK 2   <NA> Placebo  NORMAL #> 1198: 01-ABC-0200        2  Sodium      WEEK 2   <NA> Placebo  NORMAL #> 1199: 01-ABC-0200        3 Albumin     MONTH 3   <NA> Placebo  NORMAL #> 1200: 01-ABC-0200        3  Sodium     MONTH 3   <NA> Placebo    HIGH  setDF(labdata)     # shift table calculation ----  SHIFT_TABLE <- shift_table(   x = labdata, cn_visit = "VISIT",   cn_grade = "LBNRIND",   cn_usubjid = "USUBJID",   cn_lab_cat = "LBTEST",   cn_treatment = "TREAT",   cn_is_baseline = "LBBLFL",   baseline_identifier = "Y",   grade_levels = c("LOW", "NORMAL", "HIGH") )  # get attrs for post treatment ---- SHIFT_TABLE_VISIT <- attr(SHIFT_TABLE, "VISIT_N") visit_as_factor <- attr(SHIFT_TABLE, "FUN_VISIT") range_as_factor <- attr(SHIFT_TABLE, "FUN_GRADE")  # post treatments ---- SHIFT_TABLE$VISIT <- visit_as_factor(SHIFT_TABLE$VISIT) SHIFT_TABLE$BASELINE <- range_as_factor(SHIFT_TABLE$BASELINE) SHIFT_TABLE$LBNRIND <- range_as_factor(SHIFT_TABLE$LBNRIND)  SHIFT_TABLE_VISIT$VISIT <- visit_as_factor(SHIFT_TABLE_VISIT$VISIT)  # tabulator ----  my_format <- function(z) {   formatC(z * 100,     digits = 1, format = "f",     flag = "0", width = 4   ) }  tab <- tabulator(   x = SHIFT_TABLE,   hidden_data = SHIFT_TABLE_VISIT,   row_compose = list(     VISIT = as_paragraph(VISIT, "\n(N=", N_VISIT, ")")   ),   rows = c("LBTEST", "VISIT", "BASELINE"),   columns = c("TREAT", "LBNRIND"),   `n` = as_paragraph(N),   `%` = as_paragraph(as_chunk(PCT, formatter = my_format)) )  # as_flextable ----  ft_1 <- as_flextable(   x = tab, separate_with = "VISIT",   label_rows = c(     LBTEST = "Lab Test", VISIT = "Visit",     BASELINE = "Reference Range Indicator"   ) )  ft_1 .cl-c6173d90{}.cl-c6078d3c{font-family:'DejaVu title: Set flextable default styles — style
text: Modify flextable text, paragraph, cell default formatting properties. allows specify set formatting properties selection instead using multiple functions (e.g., bold, italic, bg) must applied selection rows columns.

title: Set flextable default styles — style
code: style(   x,   i = NULL,   j = NULL,   pr_t = NULL,   pr_p = NULL,   pr_c = NULL,   part = "body" )

title: Set flextable default styles — style
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. row selector, see section Row selection parameter <Selectors flextable>. j column selector, see section Column selection j parameter <flextable column selection>. pr_t object(s) class fp_text, result officer::fp_text() officer::fp_text_lite() pr_p object(s) class fp_par, result officer::fp_par() officer::fp_par_lite() pr_c object(s) class fp_cell, result officer::fp_cell() part part selector, see section Part selection part parameter <Selectors flextable>. Value '' can used.

title: Set flextable default styles — style
code: library(officer) def_cell <- fp_cell(border = fp_border(color = "wheat"))  def_par <- fp_par(text.align = "center")  ft <- flextable(head(mtcars))  ft <- style(ft, pr_c = def_cell, pr_p = def_par, part = "all") ft <- style(ft, ~ drat > 3.5, ~ vs + am + gear + carb,   pr_t = fp_text(color = "red", italic = TRUE) )  ft .cl-c69d3cce{}.cl-c6941b08{font-family:'DejaVu Sans';font-size:11pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-decoration:none;color:rgba(0, 0, 0, 1.00);background-color:transparent;}.cl-c6941b12{font-family:'Arial';font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:italic;text-decoration:none;color:rgba(255, 0, 0, 1.00);background-color:transparent;}.cl-c6970de0{margin:0;text-align:center;border-bottom: 0 solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 1.00);border-top: 0 solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 1.00);border-left: 0 solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 1.00);border-right: 0 solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 1.00);padding-bottom:0;padding-top:0;padding-left:0;padding-right:0;line-height: 1;background-color:transparent;}.cl-c697370c{width:0.75in;background-color:transparent;vertical-align: middle;border-bottom: 1pt solid rgba(245, 222, 179, 1.00);border-top: 1pt solid rgba(245, 222, 179, 1.00);border-left: 1pt solid rgba(245, 222, 179, 1.00);border-right: 1pt solid rgba(245, 222, 179, 1.00);margin-bottom:0;margin-top:0;margin-left:0;margin-right:0;}mpgcyldisphpdratwtqsecvsamgearcarb21.061601103.902.62016.46014421.061601103.902.87517.02014422.84108933.852.32018.61114121.462581103.083.21519.44103118.783601753.153.44017.02003218.162251052.763.46020.221031

title: Data summary preparation — summarizor
text: performs univariate statistical analysis dataset group formats results can used tabulator() function directly as_flextable.

title: Data summary preparation — summarizor
code: summarizor(   x,   by = character(),   overall_label = NULL,   num_stats = c("mean_sd", "median_iqr", "range"),   hide_null_na = TRUE,   use_labels = TRUE )

title: Data summary preparation — summarizor
text: x dataset columns names used grouping columns overall_label label use overall label num_stats available statistics numerical columns show, available options "mean_sd", "median_iqr" "range". hide_null_na TRUE (default), NA counts shown 0. use_labels Logical; TRUE, column labels value labels present dataset used display purposes. Defaults TRUE.

title: Data summary preparation — summarizor
text: first version function; aware can evolve change.

what: Set borders for a selection of cells — surround
title: Set borders for a selection of cells — surround
text: Highlight specific cells borders. set borders whole table, use border_outer(), border_inner_h() border_inner_v(). following functions also support row column selector j: hline(): set bottom borders (inner horizontal) vline(): set right borders (inner vertical) hline_top(): set top border (outer horizontal) vline_left(): set left border (outer vertical)

title: Set borders for a selection of cells — surround
code: surround(   x,   i = NULL,   j = NULL,   border = NULL,   border.top = NULL,   border.bottom = NULL,   border.left = NULL,   border.right = NULL,   part = "body" )

title: Set borders for a selection of cells — surround
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. row selector, see section Row selection parameter <Selectors flextable>. j column selector, see section Column selection j parameter <flextable column selection>. border border (shortcut top, bottom, left right) border.top border top border.bottom border bottom border.left border left border.right border right part part selector, see section Part selection part parameter <Selectors flextable>. Value '' can used.

title: Set tabulation marks configuration — tab_settings
text: Define tabulation marks configuration. Specifying positions types tabulation marks table paragraphs helps organize content, especially clinical tables, aligning numbers properly.

title: Set tabulation marks configuration — tab_settings
code: tab_settings(x, i = NULL, j = NULL, value = TRUE, part = "body")

title: Set tabulation marks configuration — tab_settings
text: x 'flextable' object, see flextable-package learn create 'flextable' object. row selector, see section Row selection parameter <Selectors flextable>. j column selector, see section Column selection j parameter <flextable column selection>. value object generated officer::fp_tabs(). part part selector, see section Part selection part parameter <Selectors flextable>. Value '' can used.

title: Set tabulation marks configuration — tab_settings
code: library(officer) library(flextable)  z <- data.frame(   Statistic = c("Median (Q1 ; Q3)", "Min ; Max"),   Value = c(     "\t999.99\t(99.9 ; 99.9)",     "\t9.99\t(9999.9 ; 99.9)"   ) )  ts <- fp_tabs(   fp_tab(pos = 0.4, style = "decimal"),   fp_tab(pos = 1.4, style = "decimal") )  zz <- flextable(z) zz <- tab_settings(zz, j = 2, value = ts) zz <- width(zz, width = c(1.5, 2))   save_as_docx(zz, path = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))

title: Tabulation of aggregations — tabulator
text: tabulates data.frame representing aggregation transformed flextable as_flextable. function allows define display syntax flextable table whose layout showing dimensions aggregation across rows columns.

title: Tabulation of aggregations — tabulator
code: tabulator(   x,   rows,   columns,   datasup_first = NULL,   datasup_last = NULL,   hidden_data = NULL,   row_compose = list(),   ... )  # S3 method for class 'tabulator' summary(object, ...)

title: Tabulation of aggregations — tabulator
text: x aggregated data.frame rows column names use rows dimensions columns column names use columns dimensions datasup_first additional data merged table placed columns presenting row dimensions. datasup_last additional data merged table placed end table. hidden_data additional data merged table, columns presented can used compose() mk_par() function. row_compose list call as_paragraph() - calls applied row dimensions (name used target displayed column). ... named arguments calling function as_paragraph(). names used labels values evaluated flextable created. object object returned function tabulator().

title: Tabulation of aggregations — tabulator
text: object class tabulator.

title: Tabulation of aggregations — tabulator
text: summary(tabulator): call summary() get data.frame describing mappings variables names flextable. data.frame contains column named col_keys stored names can used selections.

title: Tabulation of aggregations — tabulator
text: first version function; aware can evolve change.

title: Tabulation of aggregations — tabulator
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ set_flextable_defaults(digits = 2, border.color = "gray")  library(data.table) # example 1 ---- if (require("stats")) {   dat <- aggregate(breaks ~ wool + tension,     data = warpbreaks, mean   )    cft_1 <- tabulator(     x = dat, rows = "wool",     columns = "tension",     `mean` = as_paragraph(as_chunk(breaks)),     `(N)` = as_paragraph(as_chunk(length(breaks), formatter = fmt_int))   )    ft_1 <- as_flextable(cft_1)   ft_1 }  # example 2 ---- if (require("ggplot2")) {   multi_fun <- function(x) {     list(mean = mean(x), sd = sd(x))   }    dat <- as.data.table(ggplot2::diamonds)   dat <- dat[cut %in% c("Fair", "Good", "Very Good")]    dat <- dat[, unlist(lapply(.SD, multi_fun),     recursive = FALSE   ),   .SDcols = c("z", "y"),   by = c("cut", "color")   ]    tab_2 <- tabulator(     x = dat, rows = "color",     columns = "cut",     `z stats` = as_paragraph(as_chunk(fmt_avg_dev(z.mean, z.sd, digit2 = 2))),     `y stats` = as_paragraph(as_chunk(fmt_avg_dev(y.mean, y.sd, digit2 = 2)))   )   ft_2 <- as_flextable(tab_2)   ft_2 <- autofit(x = ft_2, add_w = .05)   ft_2 }  # example 3 ---- # data.table version dat <- melt(as.data.table(iris),   id.vars = "Species",   variable.name = "name", value.name = "value" ) dat <- dat[,   list(     avg = mean(value, na.rm = TRUE),     sd = sd(value, na.rm = TRUE)   ),   by = c("Species", "name") ] # dplyr version # library(dplyr) # dat <- iris %>% #   pivot_longer(cols = -c(Species)) %>% #   group_by(Species, name) %>% #   summarise(avg = mean(value, na.rm = TRUE), #   sd = sd(value, na.rm = TRUE), #   .groups = "drop")  tab_3 <- tabulator(   x = dat, rows = c("Species"),   columns = "name",   `mean (sd)` = as_paragraph(     as_chunk(avg),     " (", as_chunk(sd), ")"   ) ) ft_3 <- as_flextable(tab_3) ft_3  init_flextable_defaults() } # }

what: Column keys of tabulator objects — tabulator_colnames
title: Column keys of tabulator objects — tabulator_colnames
text: function provides way get column keys associated flextable corresponding tabulator() object. helps customizing programing tabulator. function using column names original dataset, eventually filters returns names corresponding selection.

title: Column keys of tabulator objects — tabulator_colnames
code: tabulator_colnames(x, columns, ..., type = NULL)

title: Column keys of tabulator objects — tabulator_colnames
text: x tabulator() object columns column names look ... filter conditions use variables names, argument columns function tabulator() (tabulator(columns = c("col1", "col2"))). type type column look , can : 'columns': visible columns, corresponding names provided '...' arguments call 'tabulator()'. 'hidden': unvisible columns, corresponding names original dataset columns. 'rows': visible columns used 'row' content 'rows_supp': visible columns used 'rows_supp' content NULL: type column

title: Column keys of tabulator objects — tabulator_colnames
code: library(flextable)  cancer_dat <- data.frame(   count = c(     9L, 5L, 1L, 2L, 2L, 1L, 9L, 3L, 1L, 10L, 2L, 1L, 1L, 2L, 0L, 3L,     2L, 1L, 1L, 2L, 0L, 12L, 4L, 1L, 7L, 3L, 1L, 5L, 5L, 3L, 10L,     4L, 1L, 4L, 2L, 0L, 3L, 1L, 0L, 4L, 4L, 2L, 42L, 28L, 19L, 26L,     19L, 11L, 12L, 10L, 7L, 10L, 5L, 6L, 5L, 0L, 3L, 4L, 3L, 3L,     1L, 2L, 3L   ),   risktime = c(     157L, 77L, 21L, 139L, 68L, 17L, 126L, 63L, 14L, 102L, 55L,     12L, 88L, 50L, 10L, 82L, 45L, 8L, 76L, 42L, 6L, 134L, 71L,     22L, 110L, 63L, 18L, 96L, 58L, 14L, 86L, 42L, 10L, 66L,     35L, 8L, 59L, 32L, 8L, 51L, 28L, 6L, 212L, 130L, 101L,     136L, 72L, 63L, 90L, 42L, 43L, 64L, 21L, 32L, 47L, 14L,     21L, 39L, 13L, 14L, 29L, 7L, 10L   ),   time = rep(as.character(1:7), 3),   histology = rep(as.character(1:3), 21),   stage = rep(as.character(1:3), each = 21) )  datasup_first <- data.frame(   time = factor(1:7, levels = 1:7),   zzz = runif(7) )  z <- tabulator(cancer_dat,   rows = "time",   columns = c("histology", "stage"),   datasup_first = datasup_first,   n = as_paragraph(as_chunk(count)) )  j <- tabulator_colnames(   x = z, type = "columns",   columns = c("n"),   stage %in% 1 )  src <- tabulator_colnames(   x = z, type = "hidden",   columns = c("count"),   stage %in% 1 )  if (require("scales")) {   colourer <- col_numeric(     palette = c("wheat", "red"),     domain = c(0, 45)   )   ft_1 <-
